intro: Ampelocissus birii, commonly known as the African ivy, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its trailing habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by red, fleshy berries. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded environments. Its woody stems and rapid growth make it suitable for covering walls or trellises.
